trans-unit.source: Implements the GenerateBootstrapper task.
Use the GenerateBootstrapper element in your project file to create and execute this task.
For usage and parameter information, see [GenerateBootstrapper Task](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ca3ba2c6-d2ea-41f2-b7e3-0fc2b0730460).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the file the bootstrapper will use to begin the installation of the application after all prerequisites have been installed.
The file the bootstrapper will use to begin the installation of the application after all prerequisites have been installed.
Gets or sets the name of the application that the bootstrapper will install.
This name will appear in the UI the bootstrapper uses during installation.
The name of the application that the bootstrapper will install.
Gets or sets whether a component runs with elevated permissions when it is installed on a target computer.
This property can be set in the project file, but it is not exposed in the MSBuild schema.
In the project file's `MsiBootstrapper` section, set the [RequiresElevation Property](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/6f449071-9caf-46e7-b7d4-7bbc21cf9aa7) to `True`.
A component runs with elevated permissions when it writes a registry key or is being installed to the GAC.
For example, if you are installing assemblies to the GAC, you need to set this property to `True`.
Returns `True` if the installed component runs with elevated permissions; otherwise `False`.
Gets or sets the Web location that is hosting the application’s installer.
The Web location that is hosting the application’s installer.
Gets or sets the built location of bootstrapper package files.

If <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.CopyComponents%2A> is `true`, the values of <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.BootstrapperComponentFiles%2A> should all be based on <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.OutputPath%2A>.
Otherwise, the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.BootstrapperComponentFiles%2A> values are based on the value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.Path%2A> property.
The built location of bootstrapper package files.
Gets or sets the products to build into the bootstrapper.
The products to build into the bootstrapper.
Gets or sets the built location of setup.exe.
The built location of setup.exe.
Gets or sets a location for the bootstrapper to look for installation prerequisites to install.
This property can have the following values::
`HomeSite`: Indicates that the prerequisite is being hosted by the component vendor.
`Relative`: Indicates that the preqrequisite is at the same location of the application.
`Absolute`: Indicates that all components are to be found at a centralized URL.
This value should be used in conjunction with the `ComponentsUrl` property.
If <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.ComponentsLocation%2A> is not specified, `HomeSite` is used by default.
The location for the bootstrapper to look for installation prerequisites to install.
Gets or sets the URL containing the installation prerequisites.
The URL containing the installation prerequisites.

Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the bootstrapper copies all output files to the path specified in the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.OutputPath"></xref> property.
The default value of this parameter is `true`.
`true` if the bootstrapper should copy all output files to the path specified in the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.OutputPath"></xref> property; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the culture to use for the bootstrapper UI and installation prerequisites.
If the specified culture is unavailabe, the task uses the value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.FallbackCulture%2A> property.
The culture to use for the bootstrapper UI and installation prerequisites.
Executes the GenerateBootstrapper task.
`true` if the task execution succeeded; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the secondary culture to use for the bootstraper UI and installation prerequisites.
The secondary culture to use for the bootstraper UI and installation prerequisites.
Gets or sets the location to copy setup.exe and all package files.
The location to copy setup.exe and all package files.
Gets or sets the location of all available prerequisite packages.
The location of all available prerequisite packages.
Gets or sets the URL to provide should the bootstrapper installation fail.
The URL to provide should the bootstrapper installation fail.
Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether the bootstrapper performs XSD validation on the specified input bootstrapper items.
The default value of this parameter is `false`.
`true` if the bootstrapper performs XSD validation on the specified input bootstrapper items; otherwise, `false`.
The Visual Studio version, in the form <major build.minor build>, for example "4.0".
Returns <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
